title: Adjust Ask button layout, limit Memory Lane to 5 slots, and remove playlist section

requirements.text: Update the Closing/Ask section so the “No” button is positioned visually below the “Yes” button (stacked under it), not overlapping or sitting on top of the “Yes” button.

quotes: tge no button plase bring it under yes not on yes

acceptanceCriteria: In the Closing/Ask section UI, the “No” button renders below the “Yes” button in the normal/resting state.
The “No” button no longer overlaps the “Yes” button at any time (including initial render).
The existing “No” button dodging behavior still works (it remains effectively impossible to click), and the existing “Yes” click behavior (modal + celebration) remains unchanged.
Layout works on mobile and desktop without causing horizontal overflow or clipped buttons.

requirements.text: Reduce the “Our Memory Lane” gallery to exactly 5 image upload/display slots by updating the editable content configuration and ensuring the UI renders only those 5 slots.

quotes: images folder i need you to give only 5 image place not 7-8

acceptanceCriteria: The Memory Lane section renders exactly 5 cards/slots and no more.
Uploading multiple images populates the first 5 slots only (no additional slots appear).

requirements.text: Remove the song/playlist section from the Valentine page so it is no longer displayed anywhere in the UI.

quotes: and the song section remove it

acceptanceCriteria: The Playlist section is not rendered in `frontend/src/components/valentine/ValentinePage.tsx`.
No playlist iframe/player is visible anywhere on the site.
The page layout remains polished with appropriate spacing between adjacent sections after removal.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any frontend immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose existing components instead.
Do not add new backend services or external databases; keep changes frontend-only unless strictly necessary.
nonGoals: Do not redesign the overall Valentine theme or rewrite existing love-letter/reasons text (only requested layout/section count/removal changes).
Do not implement persistent storage for uploaded Memory Lane images (keep current per-visit behavior).
Do not change the existing “Yes” success flow beyond what is required to reposition the “No” button below it.
